attributes.action: reduce wrongful convictions, by reversing the removal in 1994 of the corroboration requirements under the Sexual Offences Act 1956 that a person shall not be convicted of an alleged offence on the evidence of a single witness without warning the jury that there is no corroboration, AND by allowing anyone convicted on uncorroborated evidence to appeal successfully on ANY evidence which suggests that the original accuser’s evidence was unreliable.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to

rejection.details: The terms "this is likely to" and "can easily achieve" remain unsubstantiated and potentially false. For legal reasons we must be extremely careful about acceptance of petitions and would ask you to reword in order for us to accept.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
